009
010package imagingbook.common.sift;
011
012import java.awt.Shape;
013import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This class defines a SIFT descriptor. See Sec. 25.3 of [1] for more details.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
024 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2020/10/04 added scale level for display reasons
029 * @version 2022/11/20
030 */
031public class SiftDescriptor implements Pnt2d, Comparable<SiftDescriptor> {
032        
033        private final double x; // image position
034        private final double y;
035        private final int scaleLevel;
036        private final double scale;
037        private final double magnitude;
038        private final double orientation;
039        private final int[] features;
040        
041        @Override
042        public double getX() {
043                return x;
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public double getY() {
048                return y;
049        }
050
051        public double getScale() {
052                return scale;
053        }
054        
055        public int getScaleLevel() {
056                return scaleLevel;
057        }
058        
059        public double getMagnitude() {
060                return magnitude;
061        }
062
063        public double getOrientation() {
064                return orientation;
065        }
066        public int[] getFeatures() {
067                return features;
068        }
069
070        SiftDescriptor(double x, double y, double scale, int scaleLevel, double magnitude, double orientation, int[] features) {
071                this.x = x;
072                this.y = y;
073                this.scale = scale;
074                this.scaleLevel = scaleLevel;
075                this.magnitude = magnitude;
076                this.orientation = orientation;
077                this.features = features;
078        }
079        
080        // -----------------------------
081        
082        public double getDistanceL1(SiftDescriptor other) {
083                int[] f1 = this.features;
084                int[] f2 = other.features;
085                int sum = 0;
086                for (int i=0; i<f1.length; i++) {
087                        sum = sum + Math.abs(f1[i] - f2[i]);
088                }
089                return sum;
090        }
091        
092        public double getDistanceL2(SiftDescriptor other) {
093                int[] f1 = this.features;
094                int[] f2 = other.features;
095                int sum = 0;
096                for (int i = 0; i < f1.length; i++) {
097                        int d = f1[i] - f2[i];
098                        sum = sum + d * d;
099                }
100                return Math.sqrt(sum);
101        }
102        
103        public double getDistanceLinf(SiftDescriptor other) {
104                int[] f1 = this.features;
105                int[] f2 = other.features;
106                int dmax = 0;
107                for (int i = 0; i < f1.length; i++) {
108                        int d = Math.abs(f1[i] - f2[i]);
109                        dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
110                }
111                return dmax;
112        }
113        
114        // -----------------------------
115        
116        @Override
117        public Shape getShape(double featureScale) {
118                final double DisplayAngleOffset = -Math.PI / 2;
119                double x = this.getX(); 
120                double y = this.getY();
121                double scale = featureScale * this.getScale();
122                double orient = this.getOrientation() + DisplayAngleOffset;
123                double sin = Math.sin(orient);
124                double cos = Math.cos(orient);
125                Path2D poly = new Path2D.Double();      
126                poly.moveTo(x + (sin - cos) * scale, y - (sin + cos) * scale);
127                poly.lineTo(x + (sin + cos) * scale, y + (sin - cos) * scale);
128                poly.lineTo(x, y);
129                poly.lineTo(x - (sin - cos) * scale, y + (sin + cos) * scale);
130                poly.lineTo(x - (sin + cos) * scale, y - (sin - cos) * scale);
131                poly.closePath();
132                return poly;
133        }
134        
135        // -----------------------------
136        
137        @Override
138        public String toString() {
139                return String.format(Locale.US, 
140                                "x=%.1f y=%.1f s=%.2f mag=%.4f angle=%.2f", 
141                                x, y, scale, magnitude, orientation);
142        }
143
144        //used for sorting SIFT descriptors by magnitude
145        @Override
146        public int compareTo(SiftDescriptor other) {
147//              if (this.magnitude > other.magnitude) return -1;
148//              if (this.magnitude < other.magnitude) return 1;
149//              else return 0;
150                return Double.compare(other.magnitude, this.magnitude);
151        }
152
153
154
155}
